utterance.speaker: EMPLOYEE
utterance.content: Oh my God. It’s Lance Delorca.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? This was in fashion in the ‘90s?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I used to rock that in school with my Doc Martens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do realize we have a full range of All-Clad at home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This one’s my favorite. My Nonna used to make me scrambled eggs in it when I was little.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, I’m going to leave the rest of this kitchen stuff here for when my cousin Sophia moves in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I don’t think I’m going to miss this place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the floors creak, we can hear everything Mr. Kubiak does in his bathroom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You never said anything about it before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter now. You’re moving out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which can’t be said for our dead guy. An usher was closing up last night around 11:30, saw someone fleeing the scene. That’s when he found the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he say what that someone look like?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just a figure in a dark coat. As far as our vic goes, there’s no wallet, no ID, no cell. But the usher thinks he might be –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lance Delorca.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s Lance Delorca?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s that guy! He’s one of the biggest action heroes of the 1980s and a huge role model for my youth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Well, he does look a little familiar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A little? He’s the star of all the Hard Kill movies. Ex-Navy Seal Zen master Rico Cruz? With the catch phrase “Time to hit Cruz control”?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I was never a fan.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Me either. What’s he done lately, anyway?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beat leukemia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he hadn’t acted in years. Suffered a couple setbacks due to drugs and alcohol, had some box office flops, but … Lance lived in LA. I wonder what he was doing in town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And at this theater. Did he come here to watch one of his own movies?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The usher said no. And there was no ticket stub found on the body.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: There is perimortem bruising on his hands and torso. Castle’s idol must have gotten into a fight not too long before he died. Cause of death is clearly strangulation by ligature.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A narrow ligature, from the looks of it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Made by a thin wire tied to two wooden dowels. CSU found this in a dumpster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A garrote? Who would use one of those?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Special forces will sometimes, when they want to kill quietly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The bigger question is how they got the drop on Lance Delorca.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, Lance played an action hero, Castle. Doesn’t mean he was one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Au contraire, mon frère. Lance was born in Spain where, before he became an actor, he was a member of the CNI, the Spanish Intelligence Agency. He was black ops. This man was a lethal weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well …. Not lethal enough. Have CSU take a look at the murder weapon for prints. I’ll get ahold of his next of kin. We’ll see if they know who might have done this to him.

utterance.speaker: LANCE DELORCA
utterance.content: Every man has his price, El Jefe. Name yours and we can end this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There he is. Lance Delorca as Rico Cruz, squaring off with El Jefe, the ruthless drug lord, played by Henry Booth. See, in this scene El Jefe has just abducted a brilliant but buxom archaeologist from a dig in Cartagena. Now Rico is trying to pay him ransom to get her released.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “… I’ve got your zero, Rico. You need backup, just say the word.”

utterance.speaker: BROCK HARMON
utterance.content: And I’ll take them all out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was raised by a single mother. Hard Kill was how I got my brotime.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That explains so much.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Rico’s partner in all the Hard Kill movies. Booker Dane, played by Brock Harmon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, the guy from The Indestructibles movies, where all the badass action heroes band together for one last mission.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Before they die of old age?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. That’s a great film. And so was the sequel.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: El Jefe’s henchwoman, played by Brock’s wife, Naomi Duvray. The one in the black.

utterance.speaker: KAT KINGSLEY
utterance.content: Hands off me.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI DUVRAY
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: HENRY ALLEN BOOTH
utterance.content: There she is, Mr. Cruz. Your precious archaeologist.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The redhead, she’s an archaeologist? That strains credibility.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, in a good way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hard at work investigating, I see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, actually, I just called TSA and Lance flew into town two weeks ago. We’re still trying to run down where he was staying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I had CSU take a look at that garrote. There’s no prints or DNA, but it’s made out of a high-strength monofilament.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I found the next of kin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The archaeologist?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Lance married the actress. Her name’s Kat Kingsley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know what her name is. While you were having your B-movie festival, I tracked her down. She’s in New York. She’s shooting a film and she’s on her way in now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s coming here? I had her poster on my wall for like – – about a minute.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe you should sit this one out, Castle.

utterance.speaker: KAT KINGSLEY
utterance.content: This doesn’t seem real, like it’s just a … bad dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Kingsley, do you know of anyone who would have wanted to harm your husband?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: No. Of course not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time you talked to him?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: It was a week ago. We tried to meet for lunch, but it never worked out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A week ago? You two weren’t staying together?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: We were getting a divorce. I saw Lance through his cancer treatment, but after all the years, the highs, the lows, neither of us had anything left. I mean, it was amicable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what he was doing in town?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: He was shooting a film with his old partner, Brock Harmon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What film?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: The next Indestructibles movie. Brock’s directing. In fact, Lance was staying with him, so if there was trouble Brock would know about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is so cheesy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … … and by cheesy she means amazing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. Behold the miracle of cinema.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The real miracle is how a girl like that’s hanging out with a bunch of guys old enough to be her grandfather.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Serafina, the mixed martial arts star. She could beat all those guys to a pulp.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s that guy? Didn’t you make me watch a movie with him in it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rolf Magnus. He’s a Nordic bodybuilder and a card carrying member of Mensa.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. Maybe I just like the old school guys. You know, like Eastwood, Bronson, McQueen. Real actors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well then check out Clay Biggs. Graduated top of his class at Julliard, in contrast to Brock Harmon, who made his on-screen debut as a pornstar known as Brock the –

utterance.speaker: BROCK HARMON
utterance.content: Cut! That’s a cut! Steve, get me something that works or get a new job.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Harmon. Detective Beckett. This is Mr. Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi, Mr. Harmon. Huge fan. Huge fan. I – I’m – it’s an honor – honor to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: The honor is mine. I’ve passed many an hour in the john reading your books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re here about Lance Delorca.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Ah. Sad day for me. And my family.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI DUVREY
utterance.content: Here you go, darling.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, babe. If you’re a fan of mine, you’ll know my wife, Naomi Duvray. And her jewelry line, too, I hope. She just launched the spring collection. It’s nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were just outstanding as El Jefe’s henchwoman in Hard Kill. I was –

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: That is so sweet. I had a mean roundhouse kick but I wasn’t much of an actor.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Well, never stopped me. Oh, this is my son, Trey.

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: Good to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, Mr. Harmon? Could we speak privately?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Oh. Sure.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Transplant from a bone marrow donor. That’s what put Lance in remission, saved his life. He knew he’d been given a second chance. He got sober, cleaned up his act. That’s why I gave him a part in the movie. This could have been his big comeback.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we understand that he was staying with you? How did he seem?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Quiet. Secretive, I’d even say. Lance was always a man of few words, but even fewer this time out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And idea what he was doing on the Lower East Side last night at 11:30?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: I didn’t even know he was in town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said he was staying with you.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Right. Lance wrapped last week. I was told transportation took him straight from the set to the airport.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, my detectives will need to speak with the driver. Along with anyone else that Lance knew.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Um … what exactly happened? How’d he die?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um… he was strangled. With a garrote.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does that mean something to you?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: You know, Lance was CNI, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Spanish Intelligence. But what does that have to do with his murder?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Everything. He was a CNI assassin. That was his signature. He killed people with a garrote.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why it was used to kill him. Lance was murdered because he’s the Spanish Jason Bourne.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why, Castle? Because a B action movie star in a kimono said so?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it makes sense. Lance was drawing on his experience as a ruthless CNI operative to play action heroes. But his shadowy past caught up with him. Maybe it was revenge for a hit he did back in the day. Kill him the way he killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, he left CNI thirty years ago. Why would his past catch up to him now?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle might just be right about CNI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah hah! How – how am I right?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Esposito and Ryan are off interviewing folks on the set. But before the left they got on to something. They pulled Lance’s phone records and the day he died he made a phone call to Interpol in Spain, to the office of one Enrique Gomez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does Gomez have to do with CNI?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: According to his bio, Gomez used to work there, at the same time Lance Delorca did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Lance reaches out to another ex-agent and he’s killed with a garrote? Mark my words: this case is going to lead us into a labyrinthian world of deceit, villainy, and international espionage. This is better than one of his movies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After what I saw it’d have to be.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks. Update: I contacted Interpol to track down that guy Lance called, Enrique Gomez. Well, it turns out Gomez is here in New York for a meeting at the UN.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where was he last night at 11:30?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: On a redeye in from Madrid. He arrived early this morning so he’s not our killer, but Interpol will send him over for an interview. He might have insight on the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I talked to CNI to ask them about Lance’s time there. About missions that he was involved in, enemies that he might have had, and they are stonewalling me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Intelligence agencies like CNI avoid disclosing information on their employees. But I do have contacts in the State Department. Let me just ask around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. I’ve reached out to my guys in Washington as well.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. I think we’ve got something from that movie set.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We talked to the driver who took Lance to the airport.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only that’s not what he did. Lance asked the driver to drop him off at some seedy hotel on Broome Street.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And he didn’t want anybody to know about it. He paid the driver a hundred bucks to lie and say he dropped Lance off at JFK.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would he go to this hotel?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that’s where it gets weird. The unis we sent to canvass said that Lance had rented a room there for the past week.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Under the name Rico Cruz, his character from Hard Kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … okay. Have unis check for security video at the hotel and uh … let’s round up any of Lance’s personal effects from his room.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks, LT.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, I don’t understand. Why would Lance leave Brock Harmon’s Fifth Avenue digs to go stay in a flophouse?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And without telling anyone? He’s definitely up to something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey! A Hard Kill DVD. Looks like Lance was trying to relive the old days.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: “Time to hit Cruz control.” Maybe that’s what I need. Time to meet hard justice. Time for prison time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, you keep working on that, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Time to pay the bill for doing the kill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, on second thought: don’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Building schematics?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s a bunch of weird stuff in this box. A soldering iron? Blue craft paint? A microphone? A USB drive? Both empty cases? It looks like he was building something. Like a recording device.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And then he added stickers to it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stickers? What the hell is that about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But the 2 and 5 are missing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Huh. Trey. Hey, this must be Trey Harmon, Brock Harmon’s kid.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would Lance call him?

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: He wanted to ask me about the New York club scene. That’s my thing. I’m a club promoter. But I kind of shut him down, to be honest.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: After the cancer he got sober. No way was I going to help him fall off the wagon and start partying again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Do you recognize this? Think it might be the floor plan to a club?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Come on! I barely touched you!

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: I don’t know. I can barely tell what that is. Did Lance have this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And we don’t think that he wanted to party. Did he explain to you why he was interested in clubs?

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: Not really. He just said that there was something that he needed to take care of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There was something he needed to take care of. I have a theory!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Because right now I could use one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a classic action movie plot device. Lance, his black ops day long behind him, decides to go on one final mission: to vanquish his old nemesis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which would be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a rival assassin. Who was once his best friend, but then betrayed him and - or actually … a Blofeld style supervillain who killed Lance’s wife and then disappeared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but Kat Kingsley is still alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Lance’s other wife from his tragic but secret CNI past. Now, I admit I’m a little sketchy on the details of the mission and the nemesis, but … bottom line is, Lance embarked on a mission. The years caught up with him, he had lost his step. So he was dispatched by another operative who was younger, quicker, and deadlier.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And possibly female. Tory screened that security cam video from the hotel and found this. That’s Lance, leaving through the hotel lobby on his last day on Earth. And ten seconds later, this woman goes after him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s her! That’s the operative. She’s wearing a dark coat, just like the person who left the crime scene. She must have trailed Lance from the hotel, then moved in for the kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s blonde, but she might be wearing a wig. Take a look at her sunglasses and the way that she’s angled her face away from the camera. She didn’t want to be ID’d.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She may have gotten her wish. Tory said there’s not enough here to run facial recognition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, she’s wearing an earring. See if Tory can do something with that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Enrique Gomez is on his way up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he knows who she is.

utterance.speaker: ENRIQUE GOMEZ
utterance.content: Nope, I don’t recognize her. I’m sad to learn of Lance’s death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was your relationship with him, Mr. Gomez?

utterance.speaker: GOMEZ
utterance.content: We were close as young men. Less so recently.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yet he called you just before he died? Why?

utterance.speaker: GOMEZ
utterance.content: He needed a bodyguard. Somebody he could trust. And I know such people. But none of them were available on such short notice, so I couldn’t help him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why – why would Lance need a bodyguard?

utterance.speaker: GOMEZ
utterance.content: He didn’t tell me. I didn’t ask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think maybe he was going on one last mission? Perhaps his CNI past was coming back to haunt him.

utterance.speaker: GOMEZ
utterance.content: Oh, that would be rather unlikely. You see, Lance didn’t have a CNI past.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why is everyone saying that he did?

utterance.speaker: GOMEZ
utterance.content: Well, we grew up together, but I was the one who went into CNI. And when Lance came to America he asked to use my backstory to make himself more … mysterious and interesting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m – I’m sorry. Are you saying Lance Delorca wasn’t a CNI operative?

utterance.speaker: GOMEZ
utterance.content: Before he started acting he was a goat herder in the Pyrenees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So … Enrique Gomez’s story checks out. And with his authorization, CNI confirms that Lance Delorca was never an agent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My hero was a liar. And a goat herder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, well, despite this deeply personal betrayal … we still have a murder to solve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How? We’re back to square one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not necessarily. I mean, there’s still the mystery woman who followed Lance from the SRO.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: She may not be a mystery any more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is she a goat herder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I didn’t get anywhere with the earrings; they’re too common. But that got me focused on her ear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what about it? It looks normal.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: It is, but ear biometrics – size, shape, configuration – are almost as unique as fingerprints. An entire field of study is devoted to the subject.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Earology.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Earology.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: FBI seminar. So, you used her ear to identify this woman?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Yes. By isolating the ear and running it against the mug shot database. When nothing popped I ran it against photos of women who had any connection with Lance Delorca. The computer analyzed thousands of images and finally found a match with a 99.2% probability that it’s this woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Kat Kingsley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lance was killed by his soon-to-be ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So we heard Kat Kingsley was here. Whoa! Now that is a sexy outfit for an interrogation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s her costume. They took her right from the set of her movie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, she is really –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: - holding up well. What’s the movie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s direct to video. She plays a female Indiana Jones.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s an archaeologist again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So do you think it would be weird if I asked her to sign this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When? On her way to jail?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It would mean so much to me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What would her motivation be for killing Lance?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, seems her divorce was a tad messier than she lead us to believe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what role are you playing now, Ms. Kingsley? Not the grieving widow.

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: I need to get back to set or they’re going to shut down production on Raiders of the Nubian Temple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you’ve got bigger problems than that. So I talked to Lance’s lawyer and he said that your divorce was anything but amicable.

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: We’re actors. We’re passionate people. Things got stormy at times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you wanted the Malibu house and he didn’t want to give it to you.

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: That home has sentimental value to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Along with monetary value. I mean, after twenty years it’s worth … eight million dollars. And with Lance out of the picture it was all yours.

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: You think I killed my husband?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You tried to before. Remember the incident where you discharged a firearm? At him?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: I was cleaning it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know bad acting when I see it. This is you, Ms. Kingsley, following Lance hours before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: I was not following him. He asked me to meet with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he told you to wear a disguise?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: I couldn’t be seen with him after the gun thing. We were told to avoid contact. But Lance begged me. He needed cash. Two hundred thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He asked you for a loan?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: His assets were all tied up with the divorce. I inherited some money, he knew I had access to it. It wasn’t a loan. He sold me his half of the Malibu house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you telling me that he traded you four million dollars for two hundred thousand?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: How could I pass up a deal like that? I have a promissory note to prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did he need the money?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: He said he need to set something right. That he wanted to live up to the characters he played, I think? I wasn’t really listening. I just wanted him to sign over the house. I’m just being honest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. If you’re being honest then why don’t you tell me this: we have a witness who saw a dark figure fleeing the crime scene. Was that you?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you want to elaborate on that?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: Lance called me that night. From a payphone, I think. He said he was in trouble. And that people were after him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What people?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: He didn’t say. But he asked me to pick him up at this theater playing Hard Kill. That it would be easy to find. He sounded so desperate. But when I got there, he was dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell us this before?

utterance.speaker: KAT
utterance.content: I panicked! I’m trying to restart my career. I just knew how it might look.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s because it’s exactly how it does look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, not to me, it doesn’t. I don’t think she’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s just an innocent archaeologist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My opinion is not affected by her skimpy outfit. I’m speaking as an objective investigator. Someone who has set their personal feelings aside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Along with your poster?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who told you? It’s Ryan, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, Kat Kingsley admitted to being at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, when she didn’t have to. Why admit to that if you’re actually guilty?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To make herself look not guilty. Look, she had motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But parts of her story still check out: the promissory note, the withdrawal from her bank for two hundred thousand dollars. Lance said he needed the money to set something right. He needed to live up to his onscreen persona.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, according to our murder suspect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So here’s Lance, meeting with his bone marrow donor. Perhaps surviving leukemia changed him. Drove him to become a better man, a man more like the hero he portrayed. That’s why when he registered at the hotel he did so as Rico Cruz. Because he became Rico Cruz.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does that even mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That despite being an ex-goat herder with no black ops training, Lance took on a mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, okay. So we’re back to one last mission now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why else would he have the schematic, or the listening device, or why would he need a body guard?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To protect himself from Kat Kingsley.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, except for her story is still holding up. That call she says was from Lance came from a payphone six blocks from the movie theater.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, canvass for witnesses that saw Lance or anyone else by that payphone. And if he was in trouble, as Kat said, let’s find out where he was coming from.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll get into it, but we might not have anything until the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You told her about the poster?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I didn’t know it was a sec-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe it’s the way that he said it that struck a nerve.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, tact isn’t exactly the man’s middle name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, but it’s my place, you know? It’s not Castle’s. Who cares if he never liked it? I mean, I don’t know why I got so upset.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Because. To him, this is just an apartment with creaky floors. But to you, this is where you rebuilt your life, where you solved your mother’s murder. Where you fell in love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, to the best apartment ever.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: To the best apartment ever.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we struck gold on that canvass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone saw Lance using the payphone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. But they saw him before that, running like hell from an alley.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which leads us to this security cam video right here. You’ve gotta see it to believe it. These four guys have got Lance cornered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, this can’t be good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are those guys?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know, but it makes you wonder what Lance did to have them come after him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Four thugs against an aging Lance Delorca? I don’t know that I can watch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see that? What Lance just did? That belongs in one of his movies! He annihilated them!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, not for long. Half an hour later someone annihilated him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, well … right. But at least this explains the phone call. When Lance called Kat Kingsley and said “I’m in trouble, people are after me”, this is what he was talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And whoever these guys are, they must have caught up to him. We find these guys, we’ll find our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can’t ID any of these guys off of the surveillance video. Tory says that the image quality is too poor to run facial recognition or ear recognition.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The key is finding out what happened to Lance before he wound up in that alley. Something that required two hundred thousand dollars and a listening device. But whomever he went up against sent those four sides of beef after him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And after seeing the ass-whooping they got I checked nearby hospitals. Turns out that an ambulance was called to that area during our time window. They brought a heavyset dude to the ER. He was unconscious, bruised, and had a possible jaw.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, let’s go talk to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We can’t. He woke up and checked himself out of the ER before they could even get his name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does the hospital have cameras?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m glad you asked that. This guy – – definitely looks like a guy from the video.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What a second, I know that guy. Yeah, from the film set. He was dressed in Afghan garb. Brock Harmon barely tapped him in the face and he screamed like a baby.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps because he has a broken jaw?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: AD says his name is Ernest Howe. He’s playing ISIS militant number twelve.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not for long. You know what time it is? It’s Ryan time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Please. Just stop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Name’s Ryan and I hate lyin’. Ernest Howe! NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re here to talk to you about Lance Delorca.

utterance.speaker: ERNEST HOWE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a bummer that he died.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Got a little problem with your jaw there, Ernest?

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: A little TMJ.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure it’s not from that little altercation you got into the other night?

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: Look, I don’t want any more trouble.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, you’ve got trouble. Ryan trouble.

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: I don’t know what that means.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We have you on video. You and those three mooks attacked Lance and he put the hurt on all of you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But not enough hurt, because one of them killed him. Judging by your little trip to the ER, it wasn’t you. So why don’t you give us the name of your buddies, Ernest, and whoever put them up to this?

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: You’ve got it all wrong. Those guys did this to me. I was on Lance’s side. He hired me to be his bodyguard.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would Lance need a bodyguard?

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: He had a meeting at Club Drift. He wanted backup. He brought a briefcase. I think it had money in it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who did he meet there? And what was the money for?

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: I don’t know. They made me wait downstairs. But the meeting? Ended quick. All of a sudden four security dudes hustle us out and accuse Lance of wearing a wire.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A wire? Why would he be wearing a wire?

utterance.speaker: ERNEST
utterance.content: Well I didn’t exactly get a chance to ask. The last thing I remember is a guys’ foot flying across my face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Lance was wearing a wire. That would explain the microphone and the USB drive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah. Ernest said that security didn’t find a wire and there wasn’t one on Lance’s body.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But … let’s say he was all wired up with a briefcase of money. What the hell was he doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s like Lance was running some kind of half-assed sting operation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he was. I spoke narcotics. The club that Lance went to is a major hub for drug sales, run by a guy that you’re familiar with, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that – is that Henry Allen Booth?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: El Jefe from Hard Kill?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He made a career out of playing drug dealers and then he quit acting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he began living the part. Apparently he spent so much time with drug dealers, researching his roles, that he actually became one. Narcotics hasn’t been able to make a case against him, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is just like Hard Kill. Where Rico Cruz took down El Jefe. Only now it’s one actor taking on the other actor, but the other actor actually happens to be a drug dealer!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But again, why would Lance do this? Why would he go after Booth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but it’s so meta! We should really talk to El Jefe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, believe me. We will.

utterance.speaker: HENRY ALLEN BOOTH
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. I met with Lance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Old times. He wanted to share a drink. Relive the glory days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just out of the blue?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Why not? Hard Kill did a solid for both of us. Even after all these years not a day goes by where some middle aged dude doesn’t see me and shout “El Jefe!”. I suppose I shouldn’t complain. That role bought me this club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We hear that it did more than that, Mr. Booth.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: So the movie drug dealer becomes a drug dealer, huh? It would be a good story, if it were true. That being said, I don’t discourage it. A good fiction can do wonders for one’s reputation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve learned that every good fiction contains a kernel of truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened to the briefcase that Lance brought to the meeting? The one with two hundred thousand dollars in it?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Lance had no briefcase.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I suppose your guys didn’t chase him out of here and then attack him?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Doesn’t ring a bell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have video.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Not of my guys. You’re welcome to check. I doubt you’ll find any of them here. And since your next question will be where was I that night, I’ll save you the oxygen. There are about twenty people downstairs that can attest that I never left the building after Lance left. I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks for your time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Thanks for your time”? Beckett, he was lying. About the money, about the meeting, about everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course he was lying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why didn’t you push harder. Why didn’t we check his alibi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because. We didn’t need to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since I figured out what the numbers five and two meant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The missing numbers from the sticker sheet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The number 52 was on a slot car in Booth’s collection. A blue Shelby Cobra, to be exact.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what Lance was building. He put a listening device inside a replica of Booth’s cars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He must have switched them out when they had that meeting. Which means that car was recording everything in that office. Including why Lance was there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why Booth had him killed. We need to get that slot car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We will. We just need a warrant first.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: I don’t understand. You’re telling me you can’t get a search warrant even though that son of a b*tch Booth is behind this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not unless we can proved evidence that ties Booth to Lance’s death. And right now we can’t even prove that the two of them met. Look, Mr. Harmon, we were hoping that you could help us with this. Did Lance tell you he was going to the club? That he was going to talk to Booth?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Lance never said a word to me about Booth or the club. Nothing. Hell, I thought he was in LA. I wish I could help you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know what? We’ll keep looking for the men that attacked Lance. We’re not giving up.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Castle. How did Lance know to bug a slot car?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Booth and his collection were featured in Slot Zone magazine.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Huh. So you really think the proof of who killed Lance is sitting in that little blue Shelby Cobra?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t matter if we can’t get a warrant. Too bad Rico Cruz isn’t around. He’s find a way, right?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: So you .. .you’re a pretty big fan, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of Hard Kill? Ah … I was an average, ordinary fan. Not like I had the Hard Kill pajamas.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Say, the gang and I are going out for drinks later tonight. How’s you like to come with us?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Castle? Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are never going to believe what just happened. Brock invited me to go drinking with The Indestructibles. Me! With them!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you told them that you couldn’t because you’re in the middle of a case, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. What? No! I just – what – isn’t it okay if I –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you really think that I could stand between you and your boyhood dream.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are my boyhood dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Aww.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you and drinking with the Indestructibles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t always have to keep talking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to – I’m going to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know what I’m going to wear! I’ve gotta get ready!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Okay. Well, you guys, you have no idea how excited I am to …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You guys just come from set or something?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Son, we came straight from hell. Let’s roll.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So um… what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CLAY BIGGS
utterance.content: No warrant is going to stop us from getting our hands on evidence to put away Lance’s killer.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Somebody takes out one of our own, we take him out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, guys. Hey. Listen. If your plan is to go to the club and steal that slot car, no, that would – that would taint the evidence.

utterance.speaker: ROLF MAGNUS
utterance.content: Actually we can compel the DA to consider it, since the car technically belonged to the victim, Lance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really are a genius, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: ROLF
utterance.content: And also, none of us is an agent of the law.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: It’s one of the reasons I chose you.

utterance.speaker: SERAFINA
utterance.content: And because you’ve been in Booth’s office.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: You’re going to help us find that slot car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No. No, no, no, no. Guys. My wife is a cop. If I do this, she’ll kill me.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: “Oh, my wife’s going to kill me.” Is that what Rico Cruz would say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But what if we get caught?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: We’re not going to get caught. We’re The Indestructibles. Tense up, guys. It’s show time.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: The plan is simple. Once we get to the club, Serafina, Clay, Rolf, go in through the main entrance, take your positions.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Serafina, alert us when you have eyes on the rear door.

utterance.speaker: SERAFINA
utterance.content: Falcon is in the nest.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Clay. You and Rolf create a diversion to draw Booth down to the bar.

utterance.speaker: CLAY
utterance.content: Young fella, young fella. We’re doing bottle service. You got some of that Angel, you know, the champagne?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Sure so. Just going to need your credit card, Mr. Biggs.

utterance.speaker: CLAY
utterance.content: If you know who we are then you know we haven’t paid for a drink since Reagan.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Sir, Angel’s a grand a bottle. You understand.

utterance.speaker: ROLF
utterance.content: Sir, we’re here to toast our fallen comrade. That Booth too cheap to pay respects?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Mr. Booth?

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Got some old friends of yours at the bar. You should come down.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: All right, I’m coming down.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Once El Jefe’s on the move, Serafina, you’ll unlock the villa gates.

utterance.speaker: CLAY
utterance.content: Prairie dog is on the plain.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: And Castle and I will go for the goods Hard Kill style.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Always check.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: I’ve got to get going. Great seeing you, man.

utterance.speaker: ROLF
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: CLAY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey.

utterance.speaker: BOOTH
utterance.content: You know what? Whatever you want, on me. Enjoy.

utterance.speaker: CLAY
utterance.content: Abort. Abort. Prairie dog pulled a boomerang.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Booth’s on his way back up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Prairie dog is in the burrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Prairie dog is going to kill us. We’re going to be killed by a prairie dog –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m starring in my own action movie. This is the best night ever.

utterance.speaker: BROCK
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re telling me that this was handed to you by a concerned citizen?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is probably one of those times I shouldn’t keep talking. For both our sakes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The recording you are about to hear will provide incontrovertible proof that Henry Allen Booth ordered the murder of Lance Delorca.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE

utterance.content: Trey, how well do you know Henry Allen Booth?

utterance.content: And as a promoter, you had access to all the clubs in the city. Booth used that access to sell drugs in those clubs. Or so we’re told by Narcotics.

utterance.content: I don’t hear you denying this, Trey.

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: I didn’t know about the drugs at first, and once I did it was too late. He owned me.

utterance.content: Let me guess. Booth said you could buy him out, but at a price he knew you could never afford. What was it? Two hundred thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t tell your parents about any of this, did you?

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: I wanted to make my own way. Not have Brock Harmon come to the rescue.

utterance.content: But Lance found out. He tried to buy out Booth. Pay your ransom, just like Rico Cruz did in Hard Kill.

utterance.speaker: TREY
utterance.content: And I begged him not to. This wasn’t some movie. I knew that Booth wasn’t going to let me go and Lance couldn’t just walk in there with a bag of money and fix things. But suddenly he wanted to be a hero. I told him he was going to get us both killed.

utterance.content: We have an audio recording of Booth from that night.

utterance.content: How?

I figured Booth’s guys got to him. Look, I was at my office all night. I slept there. The cleaning crew saw me. I swear to you, I did not kill Lance. And I don’t know who did.

utterance.content: Tell me, Trey. Why would Lance go through all this trouble to help you?

utterance.content: So the cleaning crew confirmed Trey’s story. He is not our killer.

utterance.content: I’m not sure I understand.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: We all did. It was the least we could do.

utterance.content: Except Trey’s sample was nearly a match. Lance must have had his suspicions, because he ran a paternity test on that sample.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He would have been conceived during the filming of Hard Kill, which was inconvenient since you were already married to Brock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We spoke to your doorman, Naomi. He said that you didn’t come home until well after midnight the night that Lance was killed, so where were you?

utterance.content: I didn’t kill Lance, if that’s what you’re suggesting.

utterance.content: Okay, you need to leave.

utterance.content: We matched the wire. The wire that you use for your jewelry line, like the necklace that you’re wearing right now, it’s an exact match for our murder weapon.

utterance.content: Trey told you that Lance had something important to tell him. You knew the truth would come out.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Lance would have destroyed everything. My marriage, my family, everything that I spent almost thirty years trying to build. I couldn’t let him do that.

utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Don’t stay late. You can finish the paperwork in the morning.
